subject: Re: jUnit and Jakarta Commons Logging with log4j - LogConfigurationException
msgSnippet: I had similar problems with jasperreport. My tests ran in textui but not in gui or ant task. I resolved it by patching my junit.jar . I ve added the classes
messageBody:
I had similar problems with jasperreport. My tests ran in textui but
not in gui or ant task.
I resolved it by patching my "junit.jar".
I've added the classes used by jasperreport in
the "excluded.properties" in the jar.
More info on http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/faq/faq.htm#running_8

Bart
